title: The Future of Flight-Hailing
text: Private aviation startups use technology to pair passengers with private pilots, semi-private flights and empty legs of private jets, but can Silicon Valley startups such as Blackbird, JetSuiteX and Jettly upend established players in the $25B market? Emily Chang reports on "Bloomberg Technology.

title: Analysts slashing earnings estimates over trade fears and other headwinds, says strategist
text: Sam Stovall of CFRA and CNBC's Mike Santoli join 'Closing Bell' to discuss the markets after the close. They look at their earnings forecast for the rest of the year and oil's recent run.

title: Eurasia Group Looks to U.S.-China Policy Issues Beyond Tariffs
text: Jan.08 -- Michael Hirson, Asia director at Eurasia Group, examines non-tariff policy issues between the U.S. and China, the importance of Taiwan, and what lies ahead for China's economy.

title: 5G: Where It's Available, Who's First, What's Next
text: You might have heard that 5G is here. Now you can get on your phone and download an entire movie in a couple of seconds, right?

title: Uber Freight, Convoy Rise As Traditional Load Boards Lose Market Share
text: Upstarts Uber Freight and Convoy continued to gain market share among freight-matching rivals, as more traditional load boards saw their market share ebb in the face of more heavily digitized competition, according to a report from investment bank UBS.

title: Why this former Reagan advisor is supportive of Stephen Moore's Fed nomination
text: Arthur Laffer, former member of Reagan's economic policy advisory board, and Kathy Bost Janic, director of U.S. macro investor services at Oxford Economics,

title: Biggest Market Boogeyman 'Very Weak' Earnings, Evercore Says
text: Dennis Debusschere, managing director and head of portfolio strategy at Evercore ISI, discusses the upcoming earnings season. Federal Reserve policy, and China's economy.

title: The question Warren Buffett would ask presidential candidates
text: Warren Buffett sits down with Yahoo Finance Editor-in-Chief Andy Serwer to discuss what the Berkshire Hathaway CEO looks for in a presidential candidate.

title: SES Sees Third Generation Satellites As Disruptive Technology
text: Luxembourg-based satellite operator SES believes the next generation of units, currently under construction for launch in 2021, will prove to be a disruptive technology in the satellite communications field, improving services, expanding the number of users and reducing overall costs for communications.

title: 2019: A Record Year For IPOs?
text: Renaissance Capital's early 2019 research portended good things for the IPO market. In January, the financial firm cited a “large backlog” of U.S.

title: CMU builds a backpack with a robotic arm
text: The latest invention out of Carnegie-Mellon's snake lab is an assistive robot arm mounted to a backpack.

title: Tech spending will near $4 trillion this year. Here's where all the money is going and why
text: Spending on technology will near $4 trillion in 2019 as the cloud computing boom, threat of hacking and rapidly evolving consumer preferences in mobile demand the full attention of corporate executives to keep their companies from being disrupted.

title: Morgan Stanley: Wall Street is wrong, there will be an earnings recession this year
text: Morgan Stanley is calling for a full-blown earnings recession, while many other analysts see one negative quarter and a return to positive profit growth by the second quarter.

title: The best recent phone trends (CNET Top 5)
text: We've seen some dumb things creep into phone design, but there's some hope.

title: A Foolish Take: Have Stock Buybacks Maxed Out?
text: Record stock repurchases in 2018 look unlikely to repeat.

title: What Will Cause The Next Recession - Jim O’Neill On The World Economy
text: Jim O’Neill, a former chief economist at Goldman Sachs, says the global economy is “definitely” slowing down. While this alone might not be indicative of a recession, he says a global shock of some sort could elevate the risk of an economic contraction.

title: Chuck E Cheese parent company CEO on IPO plans
text: Tom Leverton, CEC Entertainment CEO, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Chuck E. Cheese's IPO announcement.

title: We will hear a lot about weakness abroad, says economic advisor
text: Mohamed El-Erian, Allianz chief economic adviser, joins "Squawk on the Street" to look at the global markets and whether a recession might be in the future.

title: CEO of $3 billion real estate start-up: This is the No. 1 thing to do when you buy your first home
text: "Home shopping is an emotional roller-coaster."

title: Should Investors Get Comfortable With a Goldilocks Narrative?
text: Apr.08 -- Oksana Aronov, portfolio manager at JPMorgan Asset Management, George Bory, head of fixed income research at Wells Fargo Securities, and Jim Bianco, president at Bianco Research, discuss the idea of a Goldilocks economic scenario for markets. They speak with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Markets: The Open.

title: Watch CNBC's full interview with Ray Dalio on reforming capitalism
text: Bridgewater Associates Founder Ray Dalio has made billions through the buying and selling of securities but he surprised many by saying capitalism is not working and that income inequality is a national emergency. Dalio says that one of the biggest problems facing America is the falling standards in public schools.

title: Markets open lower as industrials weigh on the Dow
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: Grab, the ride-hailing company Uber has a 27% stake in, wants to raise $2 billion
text: Grab expects to raise another $2 billion from strategic investors this year, the CEO of Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing firm said, just weeks after it announced funding of over $4.5 billion in the region's largest private financing round.

title: Saudi Aramco Order Book Said to Be $40 Billion for Dollar- Bond Sale
text: The start of Saudi Aramco's sale of its debut dollar bonds has an order book reportedly around $40 billion. Bloomberg's Matthew Martin reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas.

title: No Real Earnings Growth in 2018 -- Just Lower Taxes
text: The disconnect between real economic earnings and rising equity markets puts those who chase misleading earnings to danger.

title: Income Inequality: Why the Economy Is Not Right for All Americans
text: Peter Georgescu, chairman emeritus at Young & Rubicam and author of "Capitalists Arise!," and Torsten Slok, chief international economist at Deutsche Bank, discuss the challenges presented by income inequality and the depth of the problem in the United States.

title: Earnings Recession Is Coming, But It Doesn't Matter, Estimize CEO Says
text: Liz Young, head of market strategy at BNY Mellon Investment Management, and Leigh Drogen, founder and chief executive officer at Estimize, discuss the potential for an earnings recession and headwinds for financials in the year ahead. They speak on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon Calls Student Loans "Significant Issue"
text: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon shares his views on "irrational student lending."

title: Ray Dalio: I want people to have the same resources I had under capitalism
text: Bridgewater Associates Founder Ray Dalio has made billions through the buying and selling of securities but he surprised many by saying capitalism is not working and that income inequality is a national emergency. He joins "Squawk Box" to discuss his comments.

title: S&P 500 on longest winning streak in 18 months
text: Jack Caffrey, portfolio manager at J.P. Morgan, and Phil Orlando, chief equity strategist at Federated Investors, join "Squawk Box" to discuss the trading week ahead and what they are watching for in the broader markets, including how the Pinterest IPO might affect the market and what they're expecting from earning reports.

title: At Apple, Steve Jobs divided people into 2 groups—'insanely great' and 'crappy'
text: Only excellence matters.

title: Two economists weigh in on Ray Dalio's comments about reforming capitalism
text: As the Democratic party moves further to the left, some are questioning what the future of capitalism is in America. Jason Furman, former CEA chair and Harvard Kennedy School professor, and Phillip Swagel, former White House economist and Maryland School of Public Policy professor, join "Squawk Box" to discuss.

title: Zoom Video sets IPO terms, to raise up to $348.1 million
text: Zoom Video Communications set terms of its initial public offering, with 20.9 million shares to be sold at an expected pricing of $28 to $32 a share. The San Jose, Calif.

text: Larry McDonald, Editor of the Bear Traps Report and CNBC Contributor, talks Brazil, Mexico, and foreign markets to watch

title: Steven Wieting talks market outlook
text: Steven Wieting, Citi Private Bank Global Chief Investment Strategist, talks interest rates, global risks, and earnings

title: Palomar Holdings set terms of IPO to raise up to $95.6 million
text: Palomar Holdings Inc. set term of its initial public offering, which is expected to price between $15 to $17 a share, to value the specialty insurance company at up to $384.6 million.

title: These 11 Things Are Holding Back U.S. Economic Growth
text: According to JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, here are 11 things preventing the U.S. economy from realizing its full potential.

title: BlackRock Says U.S. Growth to `Do Its Job and Gently Push Inflation Up'
text: Apr.08 -- Isabelle Mateos y Lago, chief multi-asset strategist at BlackRock, discusses Federal Reserve policy, the U.S. economy, inflation and geopolitical risks.

title: Oil Market on its Way to Being Balanced, Says Saudi Arabia Energy Minister
text: Apr.08 -- Saudi Arabia Energy Minister Khalid Al-Falih discusses how much he's willing to do to help balance the oil market. He speaks exclusively to Manus Cranny on “Bloomberg Markets: European Open.

title: Trade uncertainty will stay with us for a long time: OECD chief economist
text: Laurence Boone, chief economist of the OECD, says a resolution to the U.S.-China dispute won't end trade uncertainty in the Western world.
